page.title: 18THE GOSPORT LINES
page.content: Here we saw the remains of gun emplacements and in some, the original gun swivels. At ground level are the 'magazines' and 'powder stores' which can still be seen. There is also a caponier, a type of outer defence. At the base of{The Ramparts}is the Moat and the water level is controlled by a sluice gate. {The Lines}could be a very attractive place to visit but we were horified to see that state they were in. There was litter all around us and people have used The Moat as a dump. There was evidence of vandalism; damage to{The Ramparts}because people will not use the steps, carvings on the trees and even a 'Tarzan' swing. We felt we needed to bring this situation to the notice of the Council.
